title: Business Development Representative - Bitso Business

As a BDR, you will be the first touchpoint for these new prospects. The relationships you build, and the meetings you create for the sales organization, will have a direct impact on our sales pipeline.

Proven, creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills. Preferred skills and qualifications: Bachelorâ€™s degree (or equivalent) or at least five years of relevant work experience. Your role is not just about selling; it's about understanding customer pain points, leveraging our unique selling propositions (USP), and developing targeted commercial offers. title: Senior Account Manager
content: As a Senior Account Manager, you will be at the forefront of our growth strategy, tasked with winning commercial deals in key markets/verticals. Your role is not just about selling; it's about understanding customer pain points, leveraging our unique selling propositions (USP), and developing targeted commercial offers. title: Senior Account Manager
content: Key Responsibilities: Engage with potential customers, understand their pain points, and effectively communicate our USP to win new business. Collaborate with Marketing to identify potential customers and provide structured feedback on generated leads. Identify customer pain points and formulate targeted commercial offers to address their specific needs. Document, track, and analyze the sales pipeline using the CRM tool (Hubspot) to ensure a robust and well-managed sales process. Maintain, refresh, and expand the sales funnel, working closely with Sales Ops to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular updates to Senior Management. Collaborate with various functions (e.g., KYC, Legal, Product) to facilitate a smooth customer onboarding process, ensuring a successful transition to production. Work closely with the Account Manager during onboarding to ensure revenue targets are achieved, and customers have an exceptional experience.

title: Localization Specialist
content: As part of the Localization team in Design, your work will have a real impact on Bitso's mission to make crypto useful, ensuring that our content effectively resonates with and suits the needs of our Mexican users. Based on your linguistic expertise and deep understanding of the country's context, you'll translate/edit/proofread the EN <> es_MX UI content to make sure that it delivers a strong local experience. You'll also collaborate with Marketing and other teams to advise on the cultural nuances of the target market, assure translation quality, consistency in messaging and adherence to brand guidelines.

title: Localization Specialist
content: Your role will also involve operational tasks, such as terminology management, style guide maintenance, and much more! If you have a passion for languages and are willing to provide top-notch quality translations that will support a dazzling in-app experience and our brand growth, we would love to hear from you! Provide high-quality English <> Mexican Spanish translations (and vice-versa) for our products, communications, and other touch points. Edit and proofread both es_MX and EN content. Work closely with the Design team to adapt our products to the local market and fix linguistic and market-specific issues before launch.

title: Financial Accounting Specialist - Trading Desk
content: Your Purpose The candidate will be part of the Finance organization and will manage the accounting for one of the Bitso entities, which engages in various business initiatives, including cryptocurrency and fiat investments, OTC trading, and intercompany payments. The candidate is expected to have a good understanding of accounting and financial investments. Reports To Accounting & Tax Manager.

title: Financial Accounting Specialist - Trading Desk
content: Who You Are Failure to meet any of the following required qualifications could result in an automatic rejection. Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or other related field. Masterâ€™s degree in Finance or participation in the CFA program is strongly preferred. At least 2 years of accounting experience. At least 2 years of exposure to financial markets. Fluent in English.

title: Financial Accounting Specialist - Trading Desk
content: What You Will Do Market Data Analysis: Analyzing market data to determine the fair value of trading positions, derivatives, and other financial instruments. Investment Valuations: Overseeing the entityâ€™s investments to ensure that their valuations are updated regularly and accurately to reflect market conditions. Impairment Calculation and Fair Value Method: Maintaining detailed documentation and justification for impairment and fair value adjustments in accordance with IFRS accounting standards. End-to-end Accounting: Meticulously managing the accounting processes for our portfolios and strategies, while ensuring compliance with accounting standards such as IFRS.

title: Financial Accounting Specialist - Trading Desk
content: Reconciliation: Conducting reconciliations between the accounting records and trading systems or documentation to ensure accuracy. Active involvement in new business initiatives: You will often need to understand transaction flows, analyze them, and raise any items that might present a concern from an accounting or regulatory point of view. Optimize and automate operational work, such as reconciliations, journal vouchers preparations and their submissions into the ERP (NetSuite). Audit Coordination: Coordinating with external auditors to provide necessary documentation and support for the audit of financial statements.

title: Financial Risk Manager
content: Your Purpose As a Financial Risk Manager at Bitso, your primary mission in the first three months will be to generate and maintain key financial risk indicators, enabling you to routinely monitor and anticipate financial risks. You will be responsible for elaborating risk assessments and reporting on significant financial risks, such as credit risk assessments, investment portfolio evaluations, and risks associated with Bitsoâ€™s products. Additionally, you will develop a proposal for a financial risk appetite statement and actively monitor exposure to financial risks, ensuring compliance with defined limits and identifying potential unmonitored events. Reports To Risk Lead.

title: Financial Risk Manager
content: Who You Are Clear and concise communicator, capable of effectively engaging and conveying ideas to senior executives. Strong relationship-building skills, both internally and externally. Demonstrates initiative and the ability to work independently. Strong critical thinking skills with the capacity to quickly grasp new and complex concepts. Proven track record in designing and implementing new policies, processes, and procedures from the ground up. In-depth knowledge of financial products and services, with experience in payment institutions, fintechs, direct credit companies, and/or banks. Extensive understanding of financial risks and their regulatory landscape. Deep knowledge of the Basel Accords and best practices in financial risk management. Mastery of financial mathematics and statistics, including creating Financial Risk Indicators (VaR, Stress Tests, Duration, Convexity, LGD, EAD, Liquidity ratios). Fluency in English is required. Desired Skills (Nice to Have): Masterâ€™s Degree or higher is highly desired. CFA and Risk Management certifications are a plus. Familiarity with one Risk Management Framework (ISO 31000, COSO, Basel Framework). 5-8 years of experience in Financial Risk Management. Experience in programming for statistical analysis purposes. Familiarity with statistical software, trading platforms, and market intelligence tools is preferred but not required.

title: Financial Risk Manager
content: What You Will Do Generate and maintain financial risk indicators to monitor financial risks and anticipate necessary actions, adjustments, and improvements. Conduct assessments and report on significant financial risks, including the review of financial statements, credit risk assessments, and evaluations of Bitsoâ€™s product-related financial risks. Develop a financial risk appetite statement proposal, monitor and control financial risk exposures, and report non-compliance or atypical events. Participate in risk committees and the Asset Management Committee (AMC). Establish methodologies, procedures, policies, and strategies for effective financial risk management, including credit, market, and liquidity risks, considering both conglomerate and individual institutional risks. Ensure all regulatory requirements are met in alignment with best practices. Evaluate and promote the capture and treatment of financial risks in the development of new products and services. Propose and implement policies, performance, and profitability evaluation models, incorporating loss prevention measures and risk mitigation strategies aligned with established limits and incentives. Familiarize yourself with the crypto environment, analyze company processes and products to identify risks. Perform periodic stress tests on policies, processes, systems, and models to identify uncaptured exposures and prevent the exploitation of established limits and incentives.
